Description: Rim sherd of Chian Simple Animal Style pottery phiale mesomphalos; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed (fired dark brown) below; dot and billet pattern frieze in added white; below, elaborate rosette in added red and white; exterior: short vertical strokes at rim; below, 'Z' frieze; below, painted decoration consisting of face of a male figure to right.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 306, no. 1223, pl. 159)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.2022) (phase 2)
